website_summaries.verdict: Perfect option for those who have large jobs to do because it ships in larger bottles than others.
pros: Has a low price per gallon compared to some others, as it is a 2 gal
Sets extremely hard, meaning it resists scratches and delivers a really tough protective layer
Easy to mix with a 1:1 ratio
cons: Seems to leave a lot of bubbles on some products, which harms the transparency

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Good Value!
customer_reviews.text: I have made multiple projects using this epoxy. It is easy to work with, has an extended working life & delivers crystal clear results. The value is exceptional and the seller is dependable. Given the free shipping, the delivery time is excellent. Thanks for giving us a good quality product at a very good price point!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Dries hard.
customer_reviews.text: Love this resin! Dries hard, is crystal clear, and easy to work with. I've tried many others and this is the best I've found. Make sure to follow the directions. I've made the mistake of not mixing it enough. It will get cloudy and mostly clear back up when mixed thoroughly; also you will feel a difference in consistency when mixed well. I mix it by hand. Check out some tables I've made with this resin. fargofurnitureco.com
customer_reviews.author: David C Collins

customer_reviews.title: Clear hard epoxy... Like it's supposed to be!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend the seller and epoxy, the price is a bit less expensive than other epoxies. The 2 gallons of epoxy came quickly was packed very well. I mixed up a bit immediately after arriving, a one-to-one ratio. I mixed it for about 5 minutes in one cup transferred it to a clean cup and mixed for another 4 or 5 minutes, poured it on and next morning it is hard as a rock, exactly as designed and perfectly clear.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: Bubbles do not clear up!!!
customer_reviews.text: I disliked this product, the bubble became intense and did not clear up. It came out a milky white color due to all the bubbles. I even used and reused the blow torch to blow them away to no success. Ruined my project that took me 3 days to prep. Had to throw it away. I want my money back!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Cervantes

customer_reviews.title: Half price works as well as top brands like Stone coat
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well and is much cheaper than stone coat which was my favorite until it became too expensive
customer_reviews.author: Matt Martell

customer_reviews.title: No smell & easy peasy!
customer_reviews.text: I finally got the resin countertop design finished. No smell at all from the resin and it was easy to mix! This pour was supposed to be a layer just to even up the surface. I had joined 2 sections together and couldn't get rid of a hump in the middle of it. Once I poured the white pearl, I just HAD to try out a design I had in my head. I figured I could cover it up if it looked really bad and I could chock it up to experience. I think I like it, though.
customer_reviews.author: S. Higbee

customer_reviews.title: 1/8” at a time y’all!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product as long as you FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS! Which I did not the first time. This is not a product for a Full one time over 1/2” inch resin river table pour. My pour was about 1.5 inches and I did it all at once. Bad idea. It went extremely exothermic -smoking within about 15-25 minutes of mixing-cracks everywhere on the table. This resin cures far too quickly on thick pours. But if you follow the directions and only do an 1/8 inch at a time-it’ll be great!! It just makes it harder to get the one deep layer look. This is more of a surface epoxy.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah

customer_reviews.title: Super clear, no bubbles, low odor
customer_reviews.text: I needed a quantity fast of decent resin for an art project - This had good reviews, shipped fast and was a fraction of the price of ArtResin. The resin is very thick, the hardener much thinner (which is great if you pour and forget which one you just poured.) The cure was quite fast, it is super clear and the few tiny bubbles cleared themselves. I will buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: twosteps

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Work With
customer_reviews.text: I've used several different brands of Epoxy but this was the first for table top epoxy. I found this to be quite difficult to work with. It did not self level on the first attempt. After additional research on table top epoxy how to videos and articles, I took what I already knew and a few tips from others', went through the process of getting the top prepped for a 2nd attempt, and much to my dismay, it still did not self level. I would have requested a return but unfortunately I waited a little too long to try this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Brenner

customer_reviews.title: Good product, needs to have equal amounts.
customer_reviews.text: The product is a good product. Releases bubbles pretty well if you warm the hardener and resin some and use a torch when finished pouring. Down side is there are not equal parts of resin/hardener in the jugs which is probably pretty imortant in a 1:1 mix.
customer_reviews.author: andrew stanfield

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: It looks great until you put something heavy on it. It dimples where our microwave sat. Even a jar of change put rings in this junk. I asked for a refund and they said to put a heat lamp on it. A month later.... Never did get my refund. Too much flack and it became pain in the @$$. Don't buy this stuff. It sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Jack M.

customer_reviews.title: Follow directions precisely
customer_reviews.text: I have done three table top coats with this product so far and had excellent results with each. Make sure you pay attention to the details with epoxy resin and you'll have a good outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Anthony

customer_reviews.title: air bubbles
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have the best results. I have a lot of little bubbles stuck inside the epoxy, not on top. the top is smooth & bubble free. This was my 2nd pour on this project. The 1st pour was a different product & was crystal clear. You can see from the side picture the bubbles in the epoxy. I mixed all 2 gallons at once with a drill and a mixing paddle.
customer_reviews.author: WHEWITT248

customer_reviews.title: long working time.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for 2 part epoxy painting so being a little thinner then other epoxy I have used before is a good thing. It mixed easy and had a long working time, over an hour. very few air bubbles to deal with and it dried rock solid and perfectly clear in less then 24 hours. customer service was great. I will buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: roy ward

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of the 2 gallon kit and I've got nothing but good things to say. Pro glass was priced really good compared to others I've purchased, there is little to no smell,flows good ,good working time and cure beautiful. I did some pours on masonite to get a feel for it then went for redoing my countertop...,very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wentz

customer_reviews.title: Different containers
customer_reviews.text: It came a few hours after the promised time But it’s OK, I haven’t tried it yet. It came in a different container not the one on the picture but I hope it’s good. I will update as soon as I use it
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: First timer!
customer_reviews.text: Had great results with this product. This was my first time using epoxy and it was really easy to use. Crystal clear shine. Made an epoxy river bar top. First pour was too thick and overheated but after that kept the pours to about a half an inch and it cured like glass. Even the layer I poured too thick did not hurt my project, was just a little scary. I definitely reccomend this epoxy. Fast shipping too. Arrived in a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Dries hard, easy to mix. I use this for all my art projects. After trying several epoxy mixes, I've settled in on this one for using in paintings and more. Very predictable and easy to use. For quality and price, it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product cures out like glass.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on several different pours. If you follow the directions and make sure the room temp is warm enough it dries absolutely beautifully. It works well with dyes and mica powders also.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cures amazingly fast
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my favorite brand of resin to use . The cure time is the fastest I’ve ever worked with. Customer service is amazing and I will continue to use this brand for my business.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very  user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a couple of different resins but have found this one easier to work with. The other epoxies did not lay down as well during the flood coat. This one was a lot more user friendly. If you follow the instructions it will produce a glass finish with no air bubbles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff, awesome customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: One box came spilled. Customer service was awesome and credited back instantly the other box was fine . Stuff is amazing !!
customer_reviews.author: Corey stephens

customer_reviews.title: Great product fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Great resin one of the best working times about 55 mins perfect for doing art resin and product dries like glass I will be buying more and price is great as well as fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: thumpa2001

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my project!
customer_reviews.text: This product completely ruined my project. While sanding, it started to peel off and continues to. Mixed exactly 1:1 with a scale and it did not harden properly. Very disappointed as it ruined a $2,000 table I was building. I will not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Engelbrecht

customer_reviews.title: Leaked into packaging
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with almost half the hardener leaked out into the box....so I've got a half gallon kut for the price of a gallon kit I guess....
customer_reviews.author: Colt

customer_reviews.title: Dries very hard
customer_reviews.text: I used this for making resin/wood bowls. Dries very hard.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE UNLESS YOU WANT BUBBLES IN YOUR WORK
customer_reviews.text: This set up way to fast, in about 30 minutes. Could not get the air bubbles out prior to it setting. Completely unsatisfied
customer_reviews.author: Unhappy customer

customer_reviews.title: Good seller. Will try products again.
customer_reviews.text: Products didn't work out for me. Contacted seller. He explained there could've been an issue somewhere along the line. Graciously refunded me and offered to send me a new kit to rectify situation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what you'd expect.
customer_reviews.text: Easy 1 to 1 ratio, crystal clear, and good for thicker poors.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Brad

customer_reviews.title: Will not cure out
customer_reviews.text: Ruined 2 projects due to this stuff. tried a little more or less hardener. mixed throuroghly. and we would still get soft or tacky areas. tied multiple thicknesses as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but caution
customer_reviews.text: Expands 2 times its size when poured into a deep crevice. That was a little unexpected and took quite a bit of sanding to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. King

customer_reviews.title: Great business people thanks fiberglass warehouse
customer_reviews.text: Love it it’s great fiberglass warehouse is business that you can trust and will answer all your questions the greatest business I ever worked with
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R Durst

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to work with. Definitely prefer over other brands used!
customer_reviews.author: Proven Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great item.
customer_reviews.text: Did entire counter top about 40 Sq ft. Had left over to spare. You need too people. Dries in about 20 mins. Also you definitely need a clear coat over it. Great product
customer_reviews.author: morris

customer_reviews.title: went hard in 2 to 5 minutes and gets hot. Completely unusable
customer_reviews.text: It went hard in 2 to 5 minutes and heated up.
customer_reviews.author: Verena F.

customer_reviews.title: Most important to know if you mix with a drill go slow and mix for two minutes..
customer_reviews.text: I like this product easy to work with for I did a shower pan also put some glow in the dark which is amazing...
customer_reviews.author: Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Mix EZ
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Predictable. Could be little lower on pricing.
customer_reviews.author: op

product_meta.title: Table Bar Top Clear Epoxy Resin - ProGlas 1000 - 2 Gallon Kit
product_meta.description:
ProGlas 1000 Bar Table Top 1:1 Epoxy Resin Coating - 1 Gallon Kit

1000 is an extremely clear, tough, high gloss epoxy coating formulated to produce a deep glass like appearance in a single layer on a sealed surface. Two or more layers are often applied for added depth and protection.

Properties

55 Minute Gel Time
3500 cps Part A
1400 cps Part B
Tensile Strength, psi: 3390
Tensile Modulus: 261.500
Flexural Strength, psi: 6752
Flexural Modulus: 197,848



Procedure :

1. Resin must be between 75 and 80 deg.Pour equal parts by volume of the Part A and Part B into the graduated cups. 

2.Mix the resin with a stir stick. Stir steadily, scraping the sides and bottom. The resin will appear hazy but will clear up after 3 or 4 minutes.

3.Apply the Seal Coat: Pour some resin on the surface and spread it around with a foam brush or squeegee until a thin layer covers the whole surface. Allow the resin to cure for 4 hours before the flood coat is added. The seal coat will prevent most bubbles from forming during the flood stage. 

4.Apply the Flood Coat: Pour the mixed resin down the length of the surface. The resin will self-level and tools are not required. Allow the resin to rundown the sides. If additional thickness or layers are needed, allow the previous layer to set up before adding more (typically 4-6 hours).

5.Eliminating Air Bubbles: Once the flood coat has settled into place, take a torch or heat gun and wave the tool 6 to 8 inches about surface. The bubbles will instantly start to pop. Repeat the process until all bubbles are gone. ***If bubbles are not rising to the surface, the resin was too cold to start with. The resin is too viscous to allow the bubbles to rise.***

6.Keep the room between 75 to 80 degrees during the curing process. It will take about half a day for the resin to become tack free, but full cure isn’t complete for another 3 days.
feature_bullets: Ultra Clear Epoxy Resin with UV Inhibitors
ProGlas 1000 has an extended "open time" which allows a work life up to 55 minutes at 77º F
Produces a Tough, High Gloss, Water Resistant Coating
